com.facebook.buck.query

Class QueryExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.query.QueryExpression
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryOperatorExpression, FunctionExpression, SetExpression, TargetLiteral, TargetSetExpression

    public abstract class QueryExpression
extends Object
    Base class for expressions in the Buck query language.

    All queries return a set of targets that match the query expression.

    All queries must ensure that sufficient graph edges are created in the QueryEnvironment so that all nodes in the result are correctly ordered according to the type of query. For example, "deps" queries require that all the nodes in the transitive closure of its argument set are correctly ordered w.r.t. each other algebraic set operations such as intersect and union are inherently unordered.

    Package overview

    This package consists of two basic class hierarchies. The first, QueryExpression, is the set of different query expressions in the language, and the eval(com.facebook.buck.query.QueryEvaluator, com.facebook.buck.query.QueryEnvironment) method of each defines the semantics. The result of evaluating a query is set of Buck QueryTargets (a file or build target). The set may be interpreted as either a set or as nodes of a DAG, depending on the context.

      • collectTargetPatterns

        public void collectTargetPatterns(Collection<String> literals)
        Collects all target patterns that are referenced anywhere within this query expression and adds them to the given collection, which must be mutable.

        This is intended to accumulate patterns from multiple expressions for preloading at once.

      • traverse

        public abstract void traverse(com.facebook.buck.query.QueryExpression.Visitor visitor)
